meanings.definition: Palest: lacking intensity of color or luminousness
meanings.sent1: The sky was paliest before the sunrise, with soft hues of pink and blue blending together.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork featured the paliest shades of gray, giving it a subtle and calming appearance.
meanings.sent3: The ghost was so paliest that it almost seemed transparent, making it hard to spot in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The room was painted in the paliest shade of yellow, resembling the faint glow of a distant star.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals were the paliest pink, as if touched by the gentlest of sunbeams.

meanings.definition: Palest: lacking in vitality or interest
meanings.sent1: His voice sounded paliest when he spoke about the most boring topic in class.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so paliest that most of the audience fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent3: The party became paliest when the music suddenly stopped, leaving everyone awkwardly silent.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was the paliest among all the team members, showing little excitement.
meanings.sent5: The book's ending was the paliest part, leaving readers feeling unsatisfied and uninterested.
